intro: Covellia subopposita, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cowwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are small and usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters. Covellia subopposita plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
